pricing.notSureDesc: Our production team can help you choose the perfect package for your project and budget.
pricing.faq1Q: How is the price calculated for different languages?
pricing.faq1A: We use a Smart Character Counter based on linguistic density. 1 minute of audio equals approximately 250 characters for CJK languages (Chinese, Japanese, Korean), 600 characters for mid-density languages (Thai, Arabic, Hindi), and 1,000 characters for English and Latin-based languages. This ensures fair and accurate pricing across all languages.
pricing.faq2A: All tiers include Performance Retakes — adjustments to tone, speed, and emphasis at no extra charge. However, Script Changes (adding, removing, or rewriting words after recording has started) are considered a new scope and will incur an additional script-change fee.
pricing.faq3Q: What if the AI mispronounces my technical terms?
pricing.faq3A: Our Director's Cut tier includes human oversight. If the AI engine fails on a specific term, we activate a process called "Micro-Patching" — the original voice actor records that exact word or phrase live, which is then seamlessly spliced into the final audio for 100% pronunciation accuracy.
pricing.faq4Q: Does the price include commercial usage rights?
pricing.faq4A: Yes! Unlike traditional agencies that charge extra for licensing, all Onyx Voiceover tiers include Standard Commercial Rights by default. You can use the audio for social media, corporate videos, podcasts, and web content — forever, with no recurring fees. (For national TV or Radio broadcast rights, please contact us for a Broadcast License upgrade.)
pricing.faq5Q: Can I control the pacing and emotion of the AI voice?
pricing.faq5A: For AI Instant Voice, pacing and emotion are fully automated by the AI engine. For maximum creative control, we recommend our Director's Cut tier, where human directors manually adjust emphasis, breathing pauses, and emotional nuance to match your brand story perfectly.
pricing.faq6A: AI Instant Voice delivers within minutes. Director's Cut and 100% Live Studio typically take 24–48 hours. For scripts exceeding 10 minutes of audio, delivery times may be extended to ensure production quality.
pricing.faq7Q: Can I have multiple voices in one order?
pricing.faq7A: Each order is processed for a single voice profile. If your project requires dialogue between two or more characters, please place separate orders for each character's lines. This ensures the AI engine (or human actor) correctly applies the intended vocal characteristics to each role.

pricing.liveStringsAddonFullDesc: Live String Recording is a premium custom add-on. Price upon request — contact our team for a personalized quote based on your project scope and instrumentation needs.
pricing.nonRefundableFullDesc: Once live recording (Vocals or Instruments) has commenced, that portion of the fee becomes non-refundable.
pricing.faq1Q: How is the production priced, and is there a duration limit per track?
pricing.faq1A: All production packages are priced "per track" and cover a maximum duration of 4 minutes. This ensures the highest quality standards for standard radio, streaming, or commercial formats. If your project requires a longer composition (e.g., a 10-minute cinematic soundscape), please contact our team for a custom quote tailored to the extended production scope.
pricing.faq2Q: What's the difference between AI Curator and Pro Arrangement?
pricing.faq2A: AI Curator uses our AI composition engine to generate a professional-quality track with human mixing — ideal for fast turnaround and budget-friendly projects. Pro Arrangement adds a dedicated human producer who arranges live guitar and instruments for radio-ready production quality. Our team includes veteran producers with major label credits and specialized vocal production experience for global animation studios.
pricing.faq3Q: Do I own the full rights to the music created by Onyx?
pricing.faq3AIntro: This depends on the tier you select:
pricing.faq3APart1: Masterpiece ($4,999): Includes an Exclusive Commercial Buyout (Full Media Buyout). You gain the exclusive, perpetual, and global right to monetize, distribute, and modify the track across all platforms (Spotify, Apple Music, Film/TV). All performers have legally waived their moral rights to ensure you receive unencumbered commercial usage. Onyx Studios, as the production house, retains Production Credit and the right to showcase the work in our professional portfolio. You may use the asset commercially without attributing individual performers. This does not grant ownership of any underlying AI model or production technology.
pricing.faq3APart2: AI Curator & Pro Arrangement: Include a Perpetual Commercial License. You are authorized to use the music for your brand, while the underlying composition ownership remains with Onyx.
pricing.faq4Q: Can I use the music on TV or in films?
pricing.faq4A: Pro Arrangement and Masterpiece include Broadcast TV and Film/Cinema rights. AI Curator covers YouTube, Social Media, and standard commercial use. To upgrade your license, please contact us.
pricing.faq5Q: What is the revision process, and what happens if I exceed the included rounds?
pricing.faq5APart1: AI Curator includes 2 revision rounds. Pro Arrangement includes 3 rounds. Masterpiece includes 5 complimentary rounds. A "round" covers all feedback provided within a single request.
pricing.faq5APart2: Beyond your included rounds: Any additional revision requests will be treated as a separate service extension. We will provide a specific quote based on the complexity of the request (e.g., minor mixing tweaks vs. significant structural changes) to ensure our production team's time is compensated fairly.
pricing.faq6Q: Am I allowed to edit the music or use it in multiple videos?
pricing.faq6A: Yes. Every Onyx license includes the Onyx Creative Freedom Clause. You have the irrevocable right to edit, re-sequence, and synchronize the audio with an unlimited number of video segments or social media posts, provided they remain within the licensed brand or project context. We do not charge additional synchronization fees for derivative works.
pricing.faq7Q: Are live strings and professional vocalists included in the base price?
pricing.faq7AIntro: We pride ourselves on transparent instrumentation:
pricing.faq7APart1: Vocalists: All tiers offer a professional vocalist as a premium add-on. Pricing is provided during the order process based on artist selection. You can browse our vocalist roster when configuring your project.
pricing.faq7APart2: Live Strings & Solo Winds: To protect session costs, Live String Ensembles and Solo Woodwinds are available as Premium Add-ons quoted separately. Please contact our team for a personalized quote.
pricing.faq7ANote: Note: We utilize world-class virtual libraries to achieve cinematic results, but full-scale live orchestral recording is not included in standard tiers.
pricing.faq8A: AI Curator: 5–7 business days. Pro Arrangement: 10–14 business days. Masterpiece: 14–21 business days. Complex projects (e.g. with live orchestral recording) may require additional time. Rush delivery is available upon request.
pricing.faq9Q: Can I request a specific genre or style?
pricing.faq9A: Absolutely. During the order process you can specify your desired genre, reference tracks, mood, and tempo. Our production team will match your creative vision. For highly specialized genres or cultural styles, we recommend the Pro Arrangement or Masterpiece tier for the best results.
pricing.faq10Q: Can I cancel my project and receive a refund once production has started?
pricing.faq10A: Due to the intensive creative labor involved, our refund policy is milestone-based. Refunds are available before production begins. Once the project enters the "Live Recording Phase" (meaning a human vocalist or session musician has been scheduled and recorded), the service fee becomes non-refundable. This policy protects our talent and ensures the sustainability of our high-end workflow. Please review our Terms of Service for full details.

about.heroSubtitle: Built on nearly two decades of broadcast excellence, now powered by cutting-edge AI
about.storyParagraph1: Onyx is powered by Fine Entertainment, a veteran recording studio operating since 2009. For nearly two decades, we have delivered thousands of projects for global brands across technology, automotive, and consumer sectors.
about.storyParagraph2: We don't just generate AI voices—we apply 17 years of human directing experience to ensure your AI audio has soul.
about.storyParagraph3: Today, Onyx Studios represents the evolution of our craft. We've integrated cutting-edge AI technology into our proven workflows.
about.storyTagline: Human Expertise + AI Efficiency = The Onyx Advantage
about.ctaSubtitle: Trusted by hundreds of clients since 2009 to bring their audio visions to life.
about.ecosystemItem1Desc: We partner with premier recording studios across multiple countries. Every project is produced in acoustically optimized environments with professional signal chains that meet international broadcast standards, ensuring consistent, high-fidelity audio quality worldwide.
about.ecosystemItem2Desc: Our production capabilities encompass professional voice talent, a resident string orchestra, session vocalists, and elite sound design. From solo voice-overs to full-scale cinematic scores, Onyx delivers high-quality results within a streamlined, professional workflow.
about.ecosystemItem3Desc: Through deep collaboration with global talent, we embed over 17 years of professional voice and music direction expertise into our AI models. This goes far beyond mere machine generation — every output undergoes emotional calibration and dynamic adjustment by professional directors, ensuring our AI audio carries genuine human emotion and soul.

This Master Terms of Service Agreement (“Agreement”) constitutes a legally binding contract between Fine Entertainment | 凡音文化有限公司, operating under the brand name Onyx Studios (“Onyx,” “we,” “us,” “our”) and you (“User,” “Client,” “you”). By accessing the Onyx Studios Platform, using our API, or purchasing any Digital Goods License (including but not limited to AI Voice, Studio Music, and Live Session services), you expressly acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these terms.

If you do not agree to these terms, you must immediately cease all use of the service.

Data Usage: All original materials and assets uploaded by the Client are used exclusively for project fulfillment and internal quality control. Onyx Studios will not utilize Client-provided source assets for any commercial purpose beyond the scope of the contracted project. For details on how we collect, use, and protect personal data, please refer to our Privacy Policy. For rules governing permissible use of the Service and generated Assets, please refer to our Acceptable Use Policy.
terms.s2Title: 2. Nature of Service: Spot Transaction Model
terms.s2Body:
To comply with banking and financial regulations, Onyx operates strictly as a digital goods retailer.

  • 2.1 Spot Transaction Only: All purchases are immediate exchanges of payment for digital goods.
  • 2.2 No Stored Value: We do not offer or support any form of digital wallet, credits, or stored value accounts.
  • 2.3 Immediate Fulfillment: Our contractual obligation is deemed fully satisfied at the moment the digital audio file is generated and made available for download, subject to the technical fault provisions in Section 10.3.
terms.s3Body:
Onyx remains the sole owner of all underlying technology and proprietary voice models. Usage rights are determined by the package purchased.

3.1 Base Packages

  • AI Instant Voice ($49 USD/block): Pure AI generation. Includes Standard Commercial Rights.
  • Director’s Cut ($149 USD/block): AI + Human Director polish. Includes Standard Commercial Rights.
  • 100% Live Studio (From $299 USD): Recorded live by professional human actors. All rights levels included.

3.2 Cumulative Rights Levels (Add-On Pricing)

  • Standard Commercial: YouTube, Social Media, Podcast, Website — included in all packages.
  • Broadcast TV & Full Media Buyout: Television, Radio, Cinema — add-on for AI Instant (+$99 USD) and Director’s Cut (+$150 USD); included in 100% Live Studio.
  • Global TV & Game Rights: All territories, all channels, gaming, OTT, streaming — add-on for AI Instant (+$199 USD) and Director’s Cut (+$350 USD); included in 100% Live Studio.

Rights levels are cumulative: Global includes all Broadcast rights, which includes all Standard rights.
terms.s4Body:
The licensing scope depends on the production methodology and the specific package purchased.

4.1 AI Curator & Pro Arrangement (Master Usage License)

  • AI Curator: Grants a Commercial Use License for the Master Recording; intended for YouTube and Social Media. Does not include Broadcast TV or Exclusive Ownership.
  • Pro Arrangement: Grants professional synchronization rights for Broadcast TV, Film, and Cinema. Onyx retains the underlying copyright; Exclusive Ownership is not granted.

4.2 Masterpiece (Full IP Ownership & Buyout)

  • Methodology: Involves mandatory human melodic intervention (modifying at least 30% of the melody) and full human production.
  • Grant: This process creates a Derivative Work under law, for which Onyx transfers Complete Ownership (Full Buyout) to the Client.
terms.s5Body:
This section applies to recording services based on client-provided MIDI or scores.

5.1 Rights & Ownership:

Upon full payment, Onyx grants 100% Ownership of the Master Recording Rights to the Client. The Client retains all rights to the underlying musical composition.

5.2 Overage Fees:

Projects exceeding the standard track duration will incur overage fees per extra minute (ranging from $200 to $350 USD depending on the ensemble size).

5.3 Deliverables:

Onyx will deliver high-resolution Multitrack Stems (24-bit/48kHz). Specific recording techniques and configurations are at the sole professional discretion of Onyx Studios.
terms.s6Title: 6. Work Made for Hire & Rights Transfer
terms.s6Body:
6.1 Talent Work Product:

All approved work produced by Onyx Talent (voice actors and singers) is performed on a Work Made for Hire basis. Upon completion, all rights — including Master Recording Rights and Composition Rights — are irrevocably transferred to Onyx Studios.

6.2 Client License Grant:

The scope of rights granted to the Client depends on the purchased package and rights level (Standard, Broadcast, or Global). Specific rights are documented in the License Certificate issued upon order completion.

6.3 Sublicensing:

Clients purchasing Broadcast or Global rights tiers are granted sublicensing rights, permitting them to sub-license the delivered asset to third-party clients as part of a larger project. Standard Commercial licenses do not include sublicensing rights.
terms.s7Body:
All performers associated with Onyx Studios have irrevocably agreed not to assert any moral rights (including the right of attribution and the right of integrity) against Onyx Studios or its authorized licensees for any works created under their engagement.

The Client is free to edit, remix, adapt, compress, or incorporate the delivered asset into derivative works without artistic restriction, subject to the scope of their purchased license.
terms.s8Body:
8.1 Issuance:

Upon completion of an order, Onyx Studios may issue a digital License Certificate documenting the specific rights granted to the Client. Each certificate is identified by a unique License ID.

8.2 Verification:

License Certificates can be verified at any time through the Onyx Studios Verification Portal. This portal is publicly accessible to facilitate due diligence by the Client or any third party.

8.3 Voice ID Affidavit:

Certain certificates may include a reference to a Voice ID Affidavit — a verified vocal recording provided by the performer confirming their identity and the lawful transfer of rights.

8.4 Indemnification:

Onyx Studios warrants that all performers in its Global Talent Network have waived their moral rights and any right to claim additional compensation directly from the Client. All assets delivered under a valid License Certificate are 100% royalty-free to the Client — the Client will never be required to pay ongoing royalties, residuals, or additional fees to any performer. Any internal compensation arrangements between Onyx Studios and its Talent are the sole responsibility of Onyx Studios.
terms.s9Body:

  • 9.2 No AI Training: You are strictly prohibited from using assets produced by this platform to train, fine-tune, or develop any AI models or machine learning systems. This prohibition is perpetual, irrevocable, and survives any termination of this Agreement.

The Client shall indemnify and hold Onyx Studios harmless from any legal claims, liabilities, or damages arising from the use of such content.
  • 9.4 Prohibited Use (Safety & Ethics): The Client shall not use the Asset to create content that is illegal, defamatory, or promotes hate speech. Specifically, the Client is prohibited from using AI-generated audio for malicious impersonation, misinformation, or any activity that violates the rights of third parties or applicable laws. For detailed usage restrictions, refer to our Acceptable Use Policy.

Once the Asset is accepted or utilized in a commercial project, the Client waives any right to claim defects or seek a refund based on artistic preference.

Publicity Embargo: Notwithstanding the above, Onyx Studios agrees to respect any project-specific embargo or non-disclosure period requested by the Client in writing. Onyx Studios will not showcase or mention the specific Assets until they have been officially released to the public by the Client.
terms.s18Body:
Onyx Studios commits to delivering audio that meets professional broadcast standards, guided by over 17 years of human directing expertise. The Client acknowledges that audio production is an inherently subjective art form and that AI-generated audio may vary in interpretation. Onyx Studios retains final artistic discretion over technical execution. Our obligation is to deliver a commercially reasonable interpretation based on the brief provided by the Client, measured by industry standard quality rather than individual subjective preference.

Onyx Studios provides services on a best efforts basis. We do not provide financial warranties beyond the scope of file replacement or re-generation as described in Section 10.3.

AI Artifacts Disclaimer: The Client acknowledges that minor variations in tone, inflection, pacing, or other subtle AI-generated characteristics (“AI Artifacts”) are inherent to the technology and do not constitute a technical defect under Section 10.3. Such variations are not grounds for refunds or claims for damages.

Authorship Warranty: The Client acknowledges that every Asset is produced under a Human-in-the-Loop framework, guided by Onyx’s professional directing expertise. This human creative intervention is intended to ensure that the Asset qualifies as a work of human authorship or a derivative work under applicable copyright laws, distinguishing it from unguided, purely automated machine output.

Talent Availability: Onyx Studios strives to provide the specific Talent selected by the Client. However, if such Talent becomes unavailable due to unforeseen circumstances (including but not limited to illness, retirement, or contractual disputes), Onyx Studios reserves the right to provide a substitute of equivalent professional quality or to offer a credit. The Client agrees that Talent unavailability does not constitute a breach of this Agreement.
terms.s19Body:
Onyx Studios warrants a Clean Chain of Title for all Assets. Our proprietary AI models are trained using legally acquired datasets and licensed vocal contributions from our Global Talent Network, whose members are engaged on a Work Made for Hire basis. We agree to defend the Client against any third-party claims of copyright infringement, provided that the Client has used the Asset within the scope of the purchased license.

Furthermore, Onyx Studios does not utilize deepfake technology to clone the voices of public figures or celebrities without explicit legal authorization. All Assets are synthesized from legally contracted performers. The Client is protected against any claims of right of publicity infringement.

terms.s39Body:
• Asset / Licensed Asset: Any digital audio file (including vocals, music, stems, and arrangements) produced or delivered by Onyx Studios under an Order.
  • Platform / Service: The Onyx Studios website, API, and all associated tools and services available at www.onyxstudios.ai.
  • Order: A completed purchase transaction for a specific digital goods license, identified by a unique Order Number.
  • License Certificate: The official digital document issued upon order completion, specifying the rights granted, identified by a unique License ID and verifiable through the Onyx Verification Portal.
  • Global Talent Network: The roster of professional voice actors, singers, and musicians contracted by Onyx Studios on a Work Made for Hire basis.
  • Full Media Buyout: A license tier under which full ownership of the Master Recording and Composition is transferred to the Client, as documented in the License Certificate. This does not grant ownership of any underlying AI model or vocal identity.
  • AI-Generated Asset: The raw output of Onyx proprietary models.
  • Human-Polished Asset: Audio refined by Onyx directors with over 17 years of expertise.
  • Derivative Work: Any modification of the Asset by the Client, provided that such work remains subject to all restrictions set forth herein, including the AI Training Ban (Section 9.2).
  • AI Twin: An AI voice model trained by Onyx Studios using Training Materials provided by a Talent under the AI Twin Program (Path A).
  • Training Materials: Original audio recordings made by a Talent specifically for the purpose of training an AI Twin model on the Onyx Studios Platform.
  • Micro-Patch: A targeted human vocal re-recording by the original Talent, replacing or enhancing a specific segment of an AI-generated Asset at a fixed platform-standard fee.
  • Archive Status: A model state in which a Talent’s AI Twin ceases all new commercial generation but is permanently retained by Onyx for license validation, copyright verification, and regulatory compliance purposes.

Construction: In this Agreement, the headings are for convenience only and do not affect interpretation. Words in the singular include the plural and vice versa. This Agreement shall be interpreted fairly and not strictly for or against either party, regardless of which party drafted it.

terms.s48Body: In any legal action or arbitration brought to enforce or interpret the terms of this Agreement, the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys’ fees, expert witness fees, and legal costs from the non-prevailing party.
terms.s49Body: Any proceedings to resolve or litigate any dispute in any forum will be conducted solely on an individual basis. The Client will not seek to have any dispute heard as a class action, private attorney general action, or in any other proceeding in which either party acts or proposes to act in a representative capacity.
terms.s50Body: Onyx Studios reserves the right to terminate any User account with thirty (30) days’ written notice. In cases where a User’s activities pose a demonstrable risk to Onyx’s brand reputation or the safety of the Talent Network, such termination may be effective upon notice. A pro-rated refund for any prepaid but undelivered services shall be the sole remedy. This right is in addition to, and not a limitation of, enforcement actions under the Acceptable Use Policy. Existing License Certificates for completed and delivered orders remain valid after account termination, subject to ongoing compliance with this Agreement.
terms.s51Body: Given the nature of generative AI, Onyx Studios does not guarantee that the Assets produced for one User will be unique or distinct from those produced for others. Unless a specific Custom Exclusivity agreement is signed, the Client accepts that similar vocal textures or musical patterns may be generated for different users within the platform’s probabilistic range. No claim of infringement or breach shall arise from such similarity.
terms.s52Body: For high-value enterprise projects, the Client warrants they maintain adequate internal security protocols to protect the Assets once delivered. Onyx Studios is not liable for data breaches, unauthorized access, or asset leakage occurring within the Client’s own digital ecosystem or third-party storage providers.
terms.s53Body: Given the high fidelity of Onyx AI voices, the Client assumes all risks regarding the emotional or psychological impact of the generated content on their audience. Onyx Studios disclaims any liability for emotional distress or perceived “Uncanny Valley” effects resulting from the use of realistic synthetic media. The Client is solely responsible for assessing the suitability of AI-generated content for sensitive audiences.
terms.s54Body:
All Talent participating in the Onyx AI Twin Program (“Path A”) have granted Onyx Studios the exclusive right to manage, host, and commercially license their AI Twin — the AI voice model trained using vocal data recorded specifically for Onyx Studios.

  • 54.1 Scope of Exclusivity: Talent shall not license, transfer, or make available the Training Materials recorded for Onyx, nor the resulting AI Twin model or any derivative thereof, to any competing platform, service, or third party.
  • 54.2 Reservation of Vocal Identity: This exclusivity applies solely to the Onyx Training Materials and the resulting AI Twin. Talent retains the unrestricted right to use their natural voice for new, independent recordings on other platforms or engagements. This provision does not constitute a non-compete restriction on the Talent’s vocal identity.
  • 54.3 Applicability: This Section applies exclusively to Talent who have elected to participate in the AI Twin Program (Path A). Talent engaged solely under Traditional Studio Recording (Path B) are not bound by this Section and are free to engage with other platforms without restriction.
  • 54.4 Talent Compensation: In consideration of this exclusive license, Onyx Studios compensates each AI Twin Talent through an internal royalty arrangement. The specific terms of such compensation are governed by the individual Talent Engagement Agreement and are confidential between Onyx Studios and the Talent. The Client is not responsible for any payments to Talent — all compensation obligations are borne solely by Onyx Studios.
terms.s55Body:
Onyx Studios maintains a clear separation between the Talent’s natural vocal identity and the proprietary technology used to create AI Twin models.

  • 55.1 Talent’s Rights: The Talent retains all rights to their natural voice and vocal identity, including their Right of Publicity. This Agreement does not transfer ownership of the Talent’s biological vocal characteristics.
  • 55.2 Onyx’s Ownership: Onyx Studios is the sole and exclusive owner of: (a) all AI model weights derived from the training process; (b) the training pipeline, algorithms, and proprietary methodologies; and (c) all related source code and technical infrastructure.
  • 55.3 No Extraction: The Talent shall not, during or after the term of their engagement, request extraction, copying, reverse engineering, or delivery of any model weights, technical parameters, or proprietary data associated with their AI Twin.
  • 55.4 Client Clarification: Clients who purchase licenses from Onyx acquire a commercial use license for the generated Asset. No Client acquires ownership of, or direct access to, the underlying AI model or its weights.
terms.s56Body:
To ensure the long-term operational security of our Clients, Onyx Studios guarantees that a Talent’s departure from the platform shall have no retroactive effect on any licenses previously granted.

  • 56.1 Existing Licenses Survive: Termination of a Talent’s engagement shall not affect any perpetual licenses already granted to third-party Clients prior to the effective termination date. All License Certificates issued before the departure remain fully valid and enforceable.
  • 56.2 Future Generation Only: Upon departure, only future AI generation using the Talent’s model will cease. The Talent’s AI Twin will no longer be available for new orders from that point forward.
  • 56.3 Talent Acknowledgment: All Talent in the AI Twin Program have irrevocably agreed that legacy Assets remain fully and perpetually licensed to existing Clients, and have waived any right to make claims against Onyx or its Clients regarding such Assets.
  • 56.4 Business Continuity Guarantee: The Client’s right to use any Asset acquired prior to a Talent’s departure is guaranteed under the same terms as documented in the original License Certificate. No additional fees, re-licensing, or consent is required from the departed Talent.
terms.s57Body:
Onyx Studios offers a Micro-Patch service that allows Clients to request a brief human re-recording of specific AI-generated segments to achieve optimal quality.

  • 57.1 Service Description: A Micro-Patch is a targeted human vocal performance by the original Talent, replacing or enhancing a specific segment of an AI-generated Asset. For Voice Actors, this covers individual lines; for Singers, this covers up to 4 bars of audio.
  • 57.2 Inclusion: Micro-Patch requests are included as part of the Director’s Cut service tier and are fulfilled at Onyx Studios’ standard operational rates. Availability and scope are subject to the terms outlined in this section.
  • 57.3 Availability: The Micro-Patch service with the original Talent is available only during the Talent’s active engagement period. Onyx Studios does not guarantee the availability of any specific Talent for Micro-Patch requests. In the event of Talent unavailability due to illness, vacation, or personal leave, pending requests may be deferred (for absences of up to 14 days) or fulfilled by an AI-based alternative or substitute Talent (for absences exceeding 14 days).
  • 57.4 Transition Period: If a Talent departs, a 30-day transition period applies during which the Talent will fulfill all pending Micro-Patch requests already in queue. After the transition period, no new Micro-Patch requests will be assigned to the departing Talent.
  • 57.5 Post-Departure Alternative: After a Talent’s departure, Clients requiring human re-recording may request an AI-based alternative or a substitute Talent with similar vocal characteristics, subject to availability.
terms.s58Body:
Upon a Talent’s departure from the Onyx Talent Network, their AI Twin model transitions to Archive Status.

  • 58.1 Archive Definition: An archived AI Twin model is retained by Onyx Studios but is no longer used for new commercial generation or made available for new client orders.
  • 58.2 Permitted Uses: Archived models may only be used for: (a) validation and verification of existing License Certificates; (b) responding to copyright inquiries, takedown requests, or legal disputes; and (c) compliance with regulatory obligations.
  • 58.3 Permanent Retention: Archived models are retained permanently. This permanent retention is necessary to ensure the ongoing integrity and verifiability of licenses previously issued to Clients. All Talent have consented to this archival retention as part of their engagement agreement.
  • 58.4 Legal Basis: The retention of archived models is grounded in Onyx’s legitimate interest under GDPR Article 6(1)(f) — specifically, the need to validate existing commercial licenses and defend against potential intellectual property claims. For additional details on data retention, please refer to our Privacy Policy.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.footer: Privacy Policy — Fine Entertainment | 凡音文化有限公司
privacy.s1Body:
Fine Entertainment | 凡音文化有限公司 (“Onyx,” “we,” “us”) respects your privacy. This policy explains how we handle your information in compliance with the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) of Taiwan.

Global Compliance: For users located in the European Union, we also comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). For users located in California, USA, we comply with the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). Our legal basis for processing personal data is primarily Contractual Necessity — the processing is required to fulfill the AI audio services you have requested. Where Contractual Necessity does not apply, we rely on Legitimate Interest or your explicit Consent.

This Privacy Policy forms part of the broader legal framework governing your use of our services. It should be read in conjunction with our Terms of Service and Acceptable Use Policy.

Your specific rights under GDPR and CCPA are detailed in Section 19 (Your Rights) below.
privacy.s2Body:
We adhere to the principle of Data Minimization. We only collect:

  • Personal Identity Information: Email address (via Magic Link authentication). No passwords required.
  • Transaction Data: Purchase history, invoice numbers, and payment timestamps.
  • Input Data: Text scripts (for Voiceover), MIDI files, and Musical Scores (PDF, MusicXML) provided by you for audio generation or live recording services.
  • Technical Data: IP address, browser type, and operating system for security and fraud prevention.
privacy.s3Body:
WE DO NOT STORE CREDIT CARD NUMBERS.

  • Processor: All payments are processed by TapPay (Cherri Tech, Inc.) and Cathay United Bank.
  • Security: Payment data is encrypted and tokenized using PCI-DSS compliant standards. Onyx only receives a transaction status and the last 4 digits of the card for identification purposes.
privacy.s4Body:
We use the collected data for the following specific purposes:

  • Service Fulfillment: To generate audio files (Voiceover/Music) or coordinate live recording sessions (Live Strings) via our studio teams.
  • No AI Training: Onyx does not use your provided scripts, lyrics, or musical scores to train or fine-tune our public AI models. Your creative inputs remain your confidential property.
  • Legal Compliance: To maintain financial records for tax authorities (retained for 5 years).
  • Communication: To send order confirmations, invoices, and critical project updates.
privacy.s5Body:
Onyx Studios prioritizes the protection of vocal identity. As an AI audio production company, we recognize that voice data may be classified as biometric information under certain jurisdictions (including the EU GDPR and the Illinois Biometric Information Privacy Act). While Onyx does not perform biometric analysis, extraction, or comparison on voice files, we store and handle all voice recordings with the same level of care required for biometric data.

  • Talent Voice Data: All voice samples from our Global Talent Network are collected with explicit, informed consent under formal Talent Engagement Agreements. These samples are stored in encrypted environments and are used exclusively for Onyx’s proprietary model training.
  • Client-Uploaded Audio: Any voice samples or reference audio uploaded by Clients for custom projects are treated as highly confidential. These files are encrypted at rest and in transit. We never share raw voice samples with third parties without explicit, project-specific consent.
  • No Unauthorized Cloning: Onyx does not use Client-uploaded voice data to create voice clones or derivative models for use outside the scope of the contracted project.
privacy.s6Body:
We strictly share data only with the following infrastructure partners necessary to operate the service:

  • Vercel Inc. (USA): Web hosting and edge deployment.
  • Supabase Inc. (USA/Singapore): Database management, authentication, and secure storage.
  • TapPay (Taiwan): Payment gateway services.

We do not sell, rent, or trade your personal data to any third party for marketing or advertising purposes.
privacy.s7Body:
As we utilize global infrastructure providers (Vercel, Supabase), your data may be transferred to and processed in the United States or Singapore. We ensure that such transfers are protected by appropriate legal safeguards:

  • Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs): For data transfers from the EU/EEA, we rely on European Commission-approved Standard Contractual Clauses to ensure an equivalent level of data protection.
  • Encryption: All data in transit is encrypted using TLS 1.2 or higher. Data at rest is encrypted using AES-256 or equivalent standards.
  • Data Processing Agreements: We maintain Data Processing Agreements (DPAs) with all infrastructure partners, ensuring they are contractually bound to protect your data in accordance with GDPR and applicable privacy laws.
privacy.s8Body:
Access to user-provided scripts, MIDI files, voice samples, and other creative materials is strictly limited to authorized Onyx personnel who require access for the following purposes only:

  • Sound Engineers & Directors: For audio production, quality assurance, and artistic direction of the contracted project.
  • Technical Support: For troubleshooting file delivery or format conversion issues.

All authorized personnel are bound by strict non-disclosure agreements (NDAs). No employee, contractor, or partner may access, copy, or distribute Client materials for any purpose outside the scope of the contracted project.
privacy.s9Body:
We employ industry-standard security measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction:

  • Encryption in Transit: All data transmitted between your browser and our servers is protected using TLS/SSL encryption (TLS 1.2 or higher).
  • Encryption at Rest: Stored data is encrypted using AES-256 or equivalent standards.
  • Access Controls: Role-based access controls ensure that only authorized personnel can access sensitive data, as described in Section 8.
  • Monitoring: We continuously monitor our infrastructure for vulnerabilities and conduct regular security assessments.

Breach Notification: In the unlikely event of a confirmed data breach affecting your personal data, Onyx Studios commits to notifying affected users within seventy-two (72) hours of discovery, in accordance with GDPR Article 33 and applicable data protection laws. For further details, please refer to Section 43 of our Terms of Service.

While no method of electronic transmission or storage is 100% secure, we are committed to maintaining the highest practical level of data protection.
privacy.s10Body:
You are strictly prohibited from using any automated systems (bots, spiders, or scrapers) to extract data or audio assets from the Onyx Studios Platform. Any attempt to reverse engineer, decompile, or derive the source code of our proprietary AI models constitutes a material violation of this policy.

Violations of this section will be pursued to the fullest extent of the law, including under the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act (CFAA) and equivalent legislation in applicable jurisdictions.
privacy.s11Body:
• Standard Files: Generated audio files are stored for 90 days. Users are encouraged to download their files immediately.
  • Masterpiece/Live Session Assets: For premium projects, we may offer extended archival storage as part of your project coordination to ensure the safety of your master stems.
  • Account Deletion: You have the right to request deletion of your personal data at support@onyxstudios.ai.
  • Legal Retention: Certain financial and transaction records may be retained for up to 5 years as required by Taiwan tax law, even after account deletion.
  • Talent Application Audio: Audio files submitted during the talent application process are retained for internal evaluation and archival purposes, as consented to during the application. This data is used solely for talent assessment and platform security, and is not used for commercial AI model training unless the applicant is accepted and signs a separate formal engagement agreement.
  • AI Model Archival (Post-Departure): When a Talent departs the Onyx Talent Network, their AI Twin model is placed in permanent Archive Status. Archived models are not used for new commercial generation. They are retained solely for: (a) validating the legitimacy of License Certificates previously issued to Clients; (b) responding to copyright inquiries or legal disputes; and (c) regulatory compliance. The legal basis for this retention is Legitimate Interest under GDPR Article 6(1)(f) — specifically, the necessity to verify and defend existing commercial licenses. This archival is permanent, as License Certificates issued to Clients are perpetual. Talent consent for this retention is obtained through the formal Talent Engagement Agreement. For the full archival framework, please refer to Section 58 of our Terms of Service.
privacy.s12Body: We use essential cookies strictly necessary for the operation of the website (e.g., login sessions). We do not use third-party advertising tracking cookies. No personal data is shared with advertising networks or social media platforms through our website.
privacy.s13Body:
Our Services are not intended for individuals under the age of 16 (or 13 in jurisdictions where COPPA applies). We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If we become aware that a minor has provided us with personal information without verifiable parental consent, we will take immediate steps to delete such data from our systems.

If you are a parent or guardian and believe your child has provided us with personal data, please contact us at support@onyxstudios.ai so we can take appropriate action.
privacy.s14Body: Onyx Studios prohibits the use of our services to generate content that is illegal, defamatory, or promotes hate speech. For full details on prohibited conduct, ethical use obligations, and the AI Training Ban, please refer to Section 9 of our Terms of Service and our Acceptable Use Policy.
privacy.s15Body:
Onyx Studios is committed to ethical AI practices. We acknowledge that our Assets are machine-generated under human direction. To ensure transparency and assist Clients in meeting their own AI disclosure obligations (including under the EU AI Act), we may include metadata or digital identifiers within the Assets to certify their origin from the Onyx Studios Platform.

Clients who are subject to AI labeling or disclosure requirements in their jurisdiction are encouraged to reference the License Certificate and embedded metadata as evidence of the Asset’s origin and production methodology. For details on our digital watermarking and fingerprinting practices, please refer to Section 46 of our Terms of Service.
privacy.s16Body: We do not use automated decision-making or profiling algorithms to determine pricing, service eligibility, or to analyze sensitive personal characteristics. Every transaction and project is handled with a focus on objective service fulfillment and creative excellence. In accordance with GDPR Article 22, users have the right not to be subject to decisions based solely on automated processing that produce legal or similarly significant effects.
privacy.s17Body:
Onyx Studios will not disclose user data to government or law enforcement agencies unless required by a valid legal order (e.g., a subpoena or court order issued by a court of competent jurisdiction). In such events:

  • Prior Notice: We will attempt to notify the affected user in advance, unless legally prohibited from doing so.
  • Minimum Disclosure: We will only provide the minimum data necessary to comply with the legal obligation.
  • Transparency Report: We may publish periodic transparency reports summarizing the number and nature of government requests received, consistent with applicable law.
privacy.s18Body: We maintain regular backups and disaster recovery procedures to minimize the impact of service disruptions on your data. For the full scope of our force majeure protections, please refer to Section 13 (Force Majeure) of our Terms of Service.
privacy.s19Body:
Depending on your location, you may have the following rights regarding your personal data:

EU/EEA Users (GDPR)

  • Right of Access: Request a copy of the personal data we hold about you.
  • Right to Rectification: Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.
  • Right to Erasure: Request deletion of your personal data (“Right to be Forgotten”).
  • Right to Restrict Processing: Request that we limit how we use your data.
  • Right to Data Portability: Request your data in a structured, machine-readable format.
  • Right to Object: Object to processing based on legitimate interest.

California Users (CCPA)

  • Right to Know: Request disclosure of the categories and specific pieces of personal data we have collected.
  • Right to Delete: Request deletion of your personal data.
  • Right to Opt-Out: Opt out of the sale of personal data. Note: Onyx Studios does not sell personal data.
  • Right to Non-Discrimination: We will not discriminate against you for exercising any of your CCPA rights.

To exercise any of the above rights, please contact us at support@onyxstudios.ai. We will respond to all verifiable requests within 30 days (or 45 days for complex requests, with prior notice).
privacy.s20Body: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices, legal requirements, or evolving AI regulations. We will notify you of any material changes by posting the revised policy on this page and updating the “Last Updated” date. Your continued use of the Service after such updates constitutes acceptance of the revised policy.
privacy.s21Body:
• Entity Name: Fine Entertainment | 凡音文化有限公司
  • Tax ID: 24312593
  • Address: 2F., No. 79, Anping Rd., Zhonghe Dist., New Taipei City, Taiwan
  • Email: support@onyxstudios.ai

For GDPR-related inquiries, EU users may also contact us at the email above. We do not currently appoint a formal Data Protection Officer (DPO) but will do so if required by the scale of our data processing activities.

aup.title: Acceptable Use Policy
aup.footer: Acceptable Use Policy — Fine Entertainment | 凡音文化有限公司
aup.s1Body:
This Acceptable Use Policy (“AUP”) defines the boundaries of permissible use for all Onyx Studios services, including AI Voice Synthesis, Studio Music Production, and Live Session Recording. This AUP forms part of the binding agreement between you and Onyx Studios and should be read in conjunction with our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.

In the event of any conflict between this AUP and the Terms of Service, the Terms of Service shall prevail. Violation of this AUP constitutes a material breach of the Terms of Service and may result in the enforcement actions described in Section 24 below.
aup.s2Body:
Users are strictly prohibited from using the Onyx Studios Platform to generate, record, or distribute any of the following:

2.1 Illegal & Criminal Activities:

Content that facilitates fraud, money laundering, promotion of controlled substances, or any activity that violates applicable law.

2.2 Hate Speech & Violence:

Content promoting discrimination, inciting hatred, or glorifying violence against any individual or group based on race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or national origin.

2.3 Sexually Explicit Content:

Hardcore pornography, non-consensual synthetic intimate media, or any content that sexualizes minors.

2.4 Intellectual Property Abuse:
  • Copyright Laundering: Uploading MIDI files or scores without proper authorization for the purpose of re-recording them through Onyx services.
  • Plagiarism: Creating works that intentionally infringe upon existing copyrighted musical compositions.
2.5 Defamatory Material:

Content that is defamatory or intended to damage the professional reputation of any individual, including members of Onyx’s Global Talent Network.

2.6 User Content Copyright Warranty:

For all MIDI files, MusicXML, PDF scores, audio samples, or any other source material uploaded for production, the User warrants they hold the necessary synchronization, mechanical, and sampling rights. This includes any third-party samples, loops, or copyrighted recordings embedded in the submission. Onyx Studios acts solely as a technical service provider (work-for-hire) and is not responsible for verifying the underlying copyright ownership of user-provided compositions. See also Section 9.3 (Client Content Warranty) of the Terms of Service.

2.7 Accessibility & Equality:

Users agree to utilize Assets in compliance with applicable accessibility and anti-discrimination laws in their jurisdiction. You shall not use Onyx AI voices to create content that mocks, discriminates against, or excludes individuals based on disability, age, or other protected characteristics.
aup.s3Body:
Users are strictly prohibited from using Onyx AI voices to create content that impersonates specific, identifiable individuals — whether public figures or private citizens — without their express legal consent. This includes:

  • Deepfake Audio: Generating audio intended to deceive listeners into believing it was spoken by a specific person.
  • Political Misinformation: Creating synthetic audio for election interference, propaganda, or deceptive political messaging.
  • Unauthorized Voice Simulation: Simulating the vocal identity of any person for non-authorized commercial use, parody presented as genuine, or reputational harm.
  • Executive Impersonation: Using Onyx’s AI engines to replicate or simulate the voice, likeness, or persona of Onyx’s founders, directors, or employees. Any attempt to use the Platform for executive impersonation, business email compromise, or voice spoofing targeting Onyx personnel will result in immediate account termination and may be subject to legal action.

This section is enforced in conjunction with the anti-cloning and IP indemnification provisions in Section 19 of our Terms of Service.
aup.s4Body:
Users are strictly prohibited from using Onyx audio assets to engage in social engineering, voice phishing (Vishing), or any activity intended to deceive individuals for the purpose of obtaining sensitive information, unauthorized access, or financial gain.

This includes but is not limited to: impersonating family members or business associates in phone calls, creating fraudulent voice authentication recordings, or producing deceptive customer service scripts designed to extract personal data.

Anti-Spam & Robo-calling: Users shall not utilize Onyx AI Voice Assets to generate mass-distributed spam, unsolicited marketing calls (robo-calls), or automated voice messages intended for harassment or fraudulent outreach. Violations may be reported to the relevant telecommunications regulatory authority in applicable jurisdictions.

Prohibition of Subliminal Manipulation: The use of Onyx Assets for subliminal messaging, coercive psychological testing, or non-consensual emotional conditioning is strictly forbidden.
aup.s5Body: Users may not use Onyx voices to generate content intended to provide authoritative medical, legal, financial, or safety advice. Onyx is a creative production tool; our generated content shall not be used as a substitute for professional certification or expert consultation in high-risk domains. Onyx Studios disclaims all liability for any harm resulting from such misuse.
aup.s6Body:
6.1 No Derivative Resale:

Clients are granted a usage license but are strictly prohibited from selling raw audio stems, vocal samples, or instrument loops generated by Onyx on third-party stock media platforms (e.g., Splice, AudioJungle, Pond5). Assets must be used as part of a larger, integrated creative work (e.g., a film, game, advertisement, or song).

6.2 No Unauthorized White-Labeling:

While users own the rights to the generated Assets as specified in their License Certificate, they are prohibited from falsely claiming the underlying AI technology or proprietary workflows as their own. You may not white-label the Onyx service or its output to suggest that you are the developer of the synthesis technology.

6.3 No Resale of Prompt Architecture:

Users may not package, redistribute, or sell the specific prompt engineering sequences or parameter configurations used to achieve specific audio results on the Onyx Studios Platform as a standalone commercial service or product.

6.4 No Secondary Copyright Squatting:

Clients may use the Assets for commercial purposes but are strictly prohibited from attempting to register the generated AI vocal characteristics or MIDI-synthesized patterns as exclusive trademarks, patents, or trade dress. You may not claim ownership over the underlying sonic DNA of the Onyx Engine.

6.5 No Rights to Latent Space or Algorithmic Weights:

The Client acknowledges that the internal mathematical weights, neural network architectures, and latent space representations of the Onyx Engine are the exclusive intellectual property of Onyx Studios. Usage of the Service does not grant any claim over the algorithmic improvements or learned representations of the models.

6.6 No NFT or Blockchain Minting:

Users are strictly prohibited from minting, fractionalizing, or incorporating Onyx-generated Assets into any Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) or blockchain-based digital assets without an explicit Secondary Market License obtained in writing from Onyx Studios.

For full details on licensing scope and resale restrictions, refer to Section 9 of the Terms of Service.
aup.s7Body:
Onyx Studios may, now or in the future, embed invisible watermarks, metadata, or digital identifiers in generated audio files (AI Voice and Music) to track license compliance and verify the origin of Assets.

Any attempt to strip, mask, alter, or circumvent these identifiers for the purpose of hiding the AI-generated origin, obscuring the source of the Asset, or evading license verification constitutes a material violation of this AUP.

Chain of Responsibility: Where such identifiers are present, the Client is responsible for ensuring that any third-party contractors, distributors, or sub-licensees do not circumvent or remove them.

Content Provenance: Onyx Studios may implement C2PA (Coalition for Content Provenance and Authenticity) standards or equivalent content credentials in the future to support content authenticity verification. The User shall not attempt to remove or forge such credentials if present.

See also Section 46 (Digital Fingerprinting & Watermarking) of the Terms of Service.
aup.s8Title: 8. Talent Protection, Anti-Bypass & Live Session Privacy
aup.s8Body:
Users engaged in Live Session or 100% Live Studio services are strictly prohibited from soliciting or hiring Onyx-contracted talent directly, bypassing the Platform. All communications and future bookings related to talent introduced via Onyx must be processed through the Onyx Studios Platform.

Any attempt to circumvent this restriction — including but not limited to contacting talent through personal social media, third-party agencies, or intermediaries — constitutes a material breach and is subject to the enforcement actions described in Section 24 below.

Live Session Privacy: During Live Session or Directing services, users may not record the session’s video feed, talent’s likeness, or behind-the-scenes conversations without explicit written consent from Onyx Studios. Any unauthorized recording or distribution of talent’s personal appearance or non-production dialogue is strictly prohibited.

This provision is enforced alongside Section 25 (Non-Solicitation & Non-Circumvention) of the Terms of Service.
aup.s9Body:
You agree not to engage in any of the following activities:

9.1 Reverse Engineering:

Any attempt to decompile, disassemble, or derive the source code of Onyx’s proprietary AI models is strictly prohibited.

9.2 No AI Training:

You are strictly prohibited from using audio files (Voice or Music) provided by Onyx to train, fine-tune, or develop any AI or machine learning systems. This prohibition is perpetual and survives any termination of your account. For full details including enforcement mechanisms, see Section 9.2 (No AI Training) and Section 34 (Compliance Verification) of the Terms of Service.

9.3 Automated Abuse:

Using bots, spiders, scrapers, or other automated systems for unauthorized data extraction or audio asset harvesting from the Onyx Studios Platform.

9.4 Data Poisoning & Malicious Inputs:

Users shall not intentionally upload corrupted MIDI files, malformed PDF scores, or scripts designed to trigger system errors or performance degradation. Onyx reserves the right to rate-limit or suspend accounts that submit high volumes of non-productive or malicious requests.

9.5 Competitive Benchmarking:

Use of the Platform for the purpose of monitoring its performance, functionality, or benchmarking against competing services is strictly prohibited. Users representing, or affiliated with, competing AI voice or music technology companies are not permitted to use Onyx services for research and development purposes.

9.6 No Model Distillation or Extraction:

Users are strictly prohibited from using Onyx-generated audio as training data to develop, fine-tune, or improve any third-party voice synthesis or machine learning models. Using our output to distill or extract the vocal characteristics for the purpose of creating a competing model is a direct violation of our Intellectual Property rights and shall be pursued under the remedies described in the Terms of Service.

9.7 Resource Integrity & Anti-Denial of Service:

Users are prohibited from engaging in activities that impose an unreasonable load on Onyx’s infrastructure, including resource hoarding via automated scripts, repetitive non-productive generation requests designed to deplete system capacity, or any action intended to increase operational costs without legitimate creative intent.

9.8 No Unauthorized Security Testing:

Users are strictly prohibited from conducting any form of red-teaming, penetration testing, or vulnerability scanning on the Onyx Studios Platform without prior explicit written authorization.

9.9 Anti-Arbitrage & Bug Exploitation:

Users are prohibited from exploiting technical bugs, system glitches, or pricing errors to obtain services, credits, or financial gains. Any assets or funds acquired through such exploitation will be deemed void, and the account will be permanently banned.

9.10 No Systematic Probing or Adversarial Prompting:

Users shall not engage in systematic querying or adversarial prompting designed to reveal Onyx’s internal logic, directing algorithms, or training methodologies.

9.11 No Style-Transfer Extraction:

Users are prohibited from using Assets to perform style-transfer analysis or to extract specific acoustic textures and sonic signatures of Onyx’s AI engines. Any attempt to replicate the unique artistic fingerprint of our models through secondary analytical tools constitutes a violation of our Trade Secret protection under Section 18 of this AUP.
aup.s10Body: The Service is not designed or intended for use in hazardous environments requiring fail-safe performance, such as life support systems, aircraft navigation or air traffic control, nuclear facility monitoring, autonomous vehicle operation, or medical emergency alert systems. Onyx Studios disclaims any and all liability for damages resulting from the use of AI Assets in high-risk, life-critical applications.
aup.s11Body:
You may not use the names “Onyx Studios” or “Fine Entertainment” in any manner that suggests an official endorsement, partnership, or sponsorship of your content without prior written consent. The use of our brand assets, logos, or trademarks for implied affiliation is strictly prohibited.

Confidentiality of Partnership: Neither party shall use the other party’s name, logo, or trademarks in press releases or marketing materials to imply a partnership without prior written consent. This is particularly critical for high-profile Live Session projects where the Client’s creative process must remain confidential.
aup.s12Body:
Onyx Studios operates in compliance with applicable international trade sanctions and export control regulations, including but not limited to:

  • Taiwan — Trade Act (貿易法) and relevant orders of the Bureau of Foreign Trade
  • United States — Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctions programs
  • United Kingdom — Office of Financial Sanctions Implementation (OFSI) regulations
  • European Union — EU Common Foreign and Security Policy (CFSP) restrictive measures

Onyx Studios does not provide services to, accept payment from, or deliver Assets to individuals or entities located in, incorporated in, or acting on behalf of the following comprehensively sanctioned jurisdictions:

North Korea (DPRK) · Iran · Syria · Cuba · Russia · Belarus · Myanmar

You represent and warrant that (a) you are not located in, organized under the laws of, or acting on behalf of any of the above jurisdictions; (b) you are not designated on any applicable sanctions or restricted-party list; and (c) you will not use the Platform to provide services or transfer Assets to any sanctioned entity, region, or for any military or dual-use purpose prohibited by applicable law.

Onyx Studios reserves the right to conduct Know-Your-Customer (KYC) verification at any time, and to immediately suspend or terminate any account or transaction that presents sanctions-related risk, without prior notice or liability.

This section supplements Section 14 (Global Compliance) of the Terms of Service.
aup.s13Body:
Where required by local law (e.g., the EU AI Act, or equivalent legislation in applicable jurisdictions), the Client is solely responsible for disclosing to end-consumers that the content was generated using AI technology. Onyx Studios provides the creative tool; the legal obligation to inform, label, or disclose AI involvement rests entirely with the User.

See also Section 15 (AI Transparency & Disclosure) of our Privacy Policy for details on metadata and digital identifiers provided by Onyx to support compliance.
aup.s14Title: 14. Prohibition of Sensitive Personal Data in Submissions
aup.s14Body: Users shall not submit scripts or input data containing sensitive Personal Identifiable Information (PII) belonging to third parties, such as government ID numbers, private medical records, financial credentials, or biometric data. Onyx Studios is not responsible for the legal consequences of processing unauthorized personal data provided by the User and reserves the right to reject or delete any submission suspected of containing such information.
aup.s15Body:
While a license is granted for the Audio Asset, it does not include the right to use the individual Talent’s legal name, personal brand, or professional history in marketing materials to imply a personal endorsement, unless a separate Celebrity Endorsement contract is signed between the parties.

For details on the perpetual rights framework protecting Talent identity, see Section 41 (Irrevocability of Transfer & Legacy Protection) of the Terms of Service.
aup.s16Body:
Onyx Studios reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to refuse service or terminate accounts associated with content that, while not strictly illegal, is deemed highly offensive, morally reprehensible, or damaging to the professional standing of Onyx Studios and its industry reputation.

Director’s Veto: For services involving human directing (e.g., Live Sessions), Onyx Studios reserves a Creative Veto. We may decline to direct or produce material that is deemed technically unfeasible or fundamentally detrimental to the artistic reputation of our leadership team.
aup.s17Body:
Onyx Studios is a technology and production service provider. The generated Assets do not reflect the opinions, values, or beliefs of Onyx Studios or its personnel. The User assumes full responsibility for the social, cultural, and political impact of the content generated and shall not imply any affiliation between the content’s message and Onyx’s corporate identity.

Technical Safe Harbor: The Client acknowledges that Onyx Studios acts as a neutral technology provider. All creative decisions, scripts, and project briefs originate from the Client, and liability for the resulting content rests solely with the Client.

Algorithmic Neutrality: The Client acknowledges that AI synthesis is based on probabilistic patterns. Onyx Studios does not intentionally program biases into its models. Any perceived social, cultural, or gender bias in the generated Assets is an inherent characteristic of large-scale machine learning and is not a reflection of Onyx’s corporate values. The User is responsible for auditing the suitability of the output for their target audience.
aup.s18Body:
While Onyx Studios supports compliance transparency, any requested audit by the Client shall be limited to data privacy practices and license compliance verification. Under no circumstances shall an audit extend to Onyx’s proprietary AI algorithms, source code, training datasets, or trade secrets.

Any permitted audit must be conducted by a mutually agreed, neutral third party under a strict non-disclosure agreement (NDA) and at the Client’s sole expense.
aup.s19Title: 19. Moral Rights & Personal Dignity of Talent
aup.s19Body: Notwithstanding the commercial license granted, Assets may not be used in content that is gratuitously cruel, fetishizes non-consensual violence, or severely violates the fundamental moral rights of the human Talent whose voice or performance was used as a base. Onyx Studios remains the sole arbiter of such violations and reserves the right to revoke licenses and pursue remedies under the enforcement provisions of this AUP.
aup.s20Body:
In the event of platform upgrades, architecture migration, or service decommissioning, Onyx Studios reserves the right to delete legacy files after a thirty (30) day notice period. Onyx is not a permanent archival service; the Client is solely responsible for the long-term storage and backup of their purchased Assets once delivered.

Orphaned Assets: In the event of a User’s death or corporate dissolution, any Assets stored on the Platform that remain unclaimed for over one hundred and eighty (180) days shall be deemed orphaned. Onyx Studios reserves the right to terminate access and permanently delete such data.

Service Tier Evolution: Onyx Studios reserves the right to reclassify features, adjust usage quotas, or transition specific algorithms between subscription tiers to reflect ongoing R&D costs and technological shifts. Continued use of the Platform after such updates constitutes acceptance of the new service structure.
aup.s21Body:
Notwithstanding our Privacy Policy, Onyx Studios reserves the right to cooperate with international law enforcement in cases of imminent threat to life or national security. We may provide specific session data to authorized agencies under a valid emergency request without prior notice to the User, to prevent the criminal misuse of AI vocal technology.

For standard (non-emergency) government data requests, see Section 17 (Requests from Legal Authorities) of our Privacy Policy.
aup.s22Body: The prohibitions in this AUP extend to any future technologies, methods, or forensic tools not yet in existence at the time of acceptance that could be used to extract, replicate, or deconstruct Onyx’s proprietary audio DNA. The spirit of “No AI Training” (Section 9.2), “No Reverse Engineering” (Section 9.1), and “No Model Distillation” (Section 9.6) shall apply to all future technological contexts without requiring an amendment to this AUP.
aup.s23Body:
Executive Escalation: Before initiating any legal action, the parties agree to a thirty (30) day cooling-off period during which the senior executives of both companies must meet in good faith to resolve the dispute.

All disputes arising under this AUP shall be governed by the laws of Taiwan (R.O.C.) and subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the New Taipei District Court, as specified in Section 11 (Governing Law and Dispute Resolution) of the Terms of Service.
aup.s24Body:
Onyx Studios may utilize human review, and may employ automated tools, to monitor compliance with this AUP. Violations may result in one or more of the following actions, at Onyx’s sole discretion:

  • Warning & Content Removal: For first-time or minor violations, a formal warning and removal of offending content.
  • Immediate Account Termination: For serious or repeated violations, termination without prior notice.
  • Forfeiture of Fees: No refunds will be issued for accounts terminated due to AUP violations.
  • Legal Action: Severe violations (including AI Training Ban breaches, fraud, or impersonation) will be reported to law enforcement agencies and pursued through civil litigation as described in the Terms of Service.
  • Post-Violation Asset Disposition: Upon termination of an account for AUP violations, Onyx Studios reserves the right to immediately and permanently delete all associated Input Data and generated Assets from its systems.

If any provision of this AUP is found unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining sections shall continue in full force and effect. For all other general legal provisions (severability, no waiver, limitation periods, binding on successors, etc.), refer to the Terms of Service.

For questions about this policy, contact us at support@onyxstudios.ai.
